Class RSSReader

java.lang.Object
  RSSReader

public class RSSReader
extends java.lang.Object

A class for parsing and outputting RSS subscriptions

Author:
Andrew Bacon, Holly French, Veronica Lynn CS 204, Spring 2013 date: 16 April 2013

getLastRun

public java.util.Date getLastRun()
This parses a date file into a date object so we know when we last ran the parser.

Returns:
date at which the feed reader was last run

setLastRun

public void setLastRun(java.util.Date lastRun)

display

public void display()
Does formatting and output and should respond to the following config options: --number (number of posts) --since (since a date in format yyyy-mm-dd, which is a date object) --title --description --newest (optional)

displayByFeeds

public void displayByFeeds(int number,
                           java.util.Date since,
                           boolean isByAlpha,
                           boolean isDescription,
                           boolean isNewest)
displayByFeeds is called by display, which is the default display setting if no date or title arguments are provided.

Parameters:
number - Number of articles to be displayed
since - Earliest date from which an article can be displayed
isByAlpha - Determines whether the display should be alphabetically by title
isDescription - Determines whether to print the articles description too

displayByDate

public void displayByDate(int number,
                          java.util.Date since,
                          boolean isDescription,
                          boolean isNewest)
displayByFeeds is called by display, which displays articles by date rather than by news source.

Parameters:
number - Number of articles to be displayed
since - Earliest date from which an article can be displayed
isDescription - Determines whether a description is included with the article

displayByTitle

public void displayByTitle(int number,
                           java.util.Date since,
                           boolean isByAlpha,
                           boolean isByDate,
                           boolean isDescription,
                           java.util.regex.Pattern title,
                           boolean isNewest)
displayByTitle displays articles that match a given regular expression for a title

Parameters:
number - Number of posts
since - Earliest date from which an article can be displayed
isByAlpha - Determines whether we sort the titles alphabetically
isDescription - Determines whether we show the article description
title - The pattern we are using to match article titles

getPostsFromFeed

public java.util.List<com.sun.syndication.feed.synd.SyndEntryImpl> getPostsFromFeed(com.sun.syndication.feed.synd.SyndFeedImpl curFeed)
Gets the posts from the feed.

Parameters:
curFeed - the current feed from which we want to get posts
Returns:
an array list of SyndEntry objects, which are the posts

getAllPosts

public java.util.ArrayList<com.sun.syndication.feed.synd.SyndEntryImpl> getAllPosts()
Gets all posts from all subscribed feeds.

Returns:
allPosts an array list of all posts

sortPostsByAlpha

public java.util.ArrayList<com.sun.syndication.feed.synd.SyndFeedImpl> sortPostsByAlpha()
This is called by the sortPosts method. It sorts posts when the mode is alpha; that is, the user wants feeds sorted alphabetically

Returns:
posts The posts sorted alphabetically

sortPostsByDate

public java.util.ArrayList<com.sun.syndication.feed.synd.SyndEntryImpl> sortPostsByDate()
This is called by the sortPosts method. It sorts posts when the mode is date; that is, the user wants posts sorted chronologically

Returns:
posts The posts sorted by date

parseArguments

public void parseArguments(java.lang.String[] args)
Parses the command line arguments provided by the user.

Parameters:
args - The arguments provided by the suer

writeTimeToFile

public void writeTimeToFile()
This writes the current time out to the date file so we can keep track of when this was last run.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Instantiates a new RSSReader, calls it with the arguments from the command line. See: http://grepcode.com/file/repo1.maven.org/maven2/org.rometools/rome- fetcher/1.2/org/rometools/fetcher/samples/FeedReader.java
